Hi Brendan,

I hope you're doing well.

I just wanted to let you know that the requested updates to the website have now been completed. This includes both the initial changes to the banner and the adjustment to move it to the bottom of the page.

Here's the link:
https://www.redohealth.com.au/appointment/

Apologies for the delay, and thank you for your patience. Please feel free to review the updates at your convenience. If there’s anything else you’d like us to adjust or if you have any new requests, don’t hesitate to let us know, we’re happy to help.
@andy Yes, I have reviewed it and we are working on it.

@manuel + @ricaR - this does not look right.
https://www.loom.com/share/dcf9642e0dd644c684cab80748594a47

Two issues:
  1. Physiotherapy not showing anything
  2. Move the box to the bottom of the page?

@andy @ricaR all good now. Please check https://www.redohealth.com.au/appointment/

(Time: 5mins)

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia assigned to Manuel Lito Manceli

full_threads.body: @andy Yes, I’ll need to forward this to @manuel, as he’s the one who created the form. There are logic conditions involved that will need to be adjusted in order to make this change.

@ricaR - we need to take away the next available therapist option .

In transcript Brendon said 'I basically just wanted to take away the next available therapist option and got an email back and told not to go into do any more editing.'

Is that something we can edit on our end?

@andy
  • Brendan initially requested the banner to be updated, which was completed.
  • I responded to his request via email on May 16.
  • He then followed up with another request to move the banner to the bottom of the page, which we also implemented.
  • It seems Glen closed the ticket without replying to Brendan, even though the requested changes were already applied to the website.
  • Brendan has now submitted a new request to remove the "Next Therapist Available" option from the form, this is a separate task entirely.

So I'm not quite sure what he means by saying it "has no action yet."
